text: Hello, I have a really stupid issue. I'm pretty new to CLI and I wonder, how do I upload files? And yes, I follow the CLI guide, but when I use my Visual Studio Code, I keep getting [ERROR] `src` is a module path but `dest` is not. What do I do wrong with the destination? What should be included in it? I'm working in folder that is already authenticated, so I use something simple as /My_Theme/modules, which is copied path from  the design manager. Thank you for your help :slightly_smiling_face:
Could you share your full cli command
I’ve run into this; you need to either watch/upload a parent directory or upload specifically to a folder with “.module” in it, so something like `/My_Theme/modules/example-module.module`

Thank you <@U26BLKGE4>, I will try it out once I get home to my computer. <@UG7S8J18D>, my Visual Studio Code accepts parameters one by one, so I first run
hs upload
then it asks me for source, so I put in the source I copy in visual studio of the folder I want to copy, then it says its OK, and then it asks me separately for destination. Which I enter and it gives me the error.
Im too sucky to run it in one go, as I have tried, but since it kept giving errors, I tried section by section, and discovered that destination is a problem.

Thank you much <@U26BLKGE4>, funny enough, I couldnt pull it through, so I started making you a video of step by step what I do. And during making that video it actually worked, lol. It still gave some error at the end, but it doesnt look important. I hope.
[ERROR] Cannot deserialize value of type `java.util.ArrayList<com.HubSpot.content.model.customwidgets.Field>` from Object value (token `JsonToken.START_OBJECT`) (line:1, column:1)


Thank you much!
